page.title: 12The towers-cont'd
page.content: money to repair it.By the seventeenth century there was quite a fair sized village at Reculver but the main problem for the church was not so much shortage of money but the sea.The sea became its main enemy.The land at Reculver was slowly being eaten away by the sea.Many of the cottages were threatened as well.In 1808 the raveyard fell into the sea along with a number of other buildings.The local people got together to discusss what should be done.Legend has it that the vicar's wife did not like living there and she persuaded her husband to get the church moved further inland.The church was mostly demolished and materials sold off, most of the stone was used to build the new church.Trinity House bought the towers as navigational aids and built groynes on he beach to help keep back the sea.
